security: Revealing specific travel precautions, security regulations, and cover story details could compromise future overseas operations and personnel safety. Quoting the document: 'Travel Precautions (to carry nothing identifying him with CIA).' and 'Cover Story (nature of cover; adequacy or prior briefing; possibility of inconsistencies; briefing of spouse).'
summary: An interview processing sheet documents a pre-departure briefing for David L. Morales, covering security regulations, travel precautions, cover story maintenance, personal affairs, correspondence, and conduct, prior to his overseas travel.
summary_one_paragraph: This document is an interview processing sheet for David L. Morales, #39418, dated 28 November 1953, concerning his upcoming overseas travel to an undisclosed location. The interview, conducted by R., covered essential security topics such as general security regulations, travel precautions (specifically avoiding carrying anything identifying him with the CIA), maintaining his cover story, managing personal affairs securely, controlling personal correspondence, and ensuring proper personal conduct, including avoiding black market activities and undue curiosity about locals. The sheet indicates that Morales was also polygraph tested and completed CLC training.
title: Interview Processing Sheet for David L. Morales
